text: ਬਿਭਾਸ ਪ੍ਰਭਾਤੀ ਬਾਣੀ ਭਗਤ ਕਬੀਰ ਜੀ ਕੀ
section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Bibhaas, Prabhaatee, The Word Of Devotee Kabeer Jee:

transliteration.text: bibhās prabhātī bānī bhagat kabīr jī kī

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: My anxious fears of death and rebirth have been taken away.

melody.description: Bibhas Parbhati has a self-assured character and has a sense of certainty, which arises from the knowledge gained through awareness. It conveys the wisdom achieved from learning, which inspires contentment. However, this wisdom is not arrogant, but is gentle in its persuasion because there is not a need to ‘show-off’ this knowledge, but a desire to share it, so the recipient is able to learn.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The Celestial Lord has shown His Love for me. ||1||

melody.description: Bibhas Parbhati has a self-assured character and has a sense of certainty, which arises from the knowledge gained through awareness. It conveys the wisdom achieved from learning, which inspires contentment. However, this wisdom is not arrogant, but is gentle in its persuasion because there is not a need to ‘show-off’ this knowledge, but a desire to share it, so the recipient is able to learn.

section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The Divine Light has dawned, and darkness has been dispelled.

melody.description: Bibhas Parbhati has a self-assured character and has a sense of certainty, which arises from the knowledge gained through awareness. It conveys the wisdom achieved from learning, which inspires contentment. However, this wisdom is not arrogant, but is gentle in its persuasion because there is not a need to ‘show-off’ this knowledge, but a desire to share it, so the recipient is able to learn.

text: ਰਾਮ ਰਤਨੁ ਪਾਇਆ ਕਰਤ ਬੀਚਾਰਾ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Contemplating the Lord, I have obtained the Jewel of His Name. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: rām ratan pāiā karat bīchārā .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Bibhas Parbhati has a self-assured character and has a sense of certainty, which arises from the knowledge gained through awareness. It conveys the wisdom achieved from learning, which inspires contentment. However, this wisdom is not arrogant, but is gentle in its persuasion because there is not a need to ‘show-off’ this knowledge, but a desire to share it, so the recipient is able to learn.

section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Pain runs far away from that place where there is bliss.

melody.description: Bibhas Parbhati has a self-assured character and has a sense of certainty, which arises from the knowledge gained through awareness. It conveys the wisdom achieved from learning, which inspires contentment. However, this wisdom is not arrogant, but is gentle in its persuasion because there is not a need to ‘show-off’ this knowledge, but a desire to share it, so the recipient is able to learn.

section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The jewel of the mind is focused and attuned to the essence of reality. ||2||

text: ਜੋ ਕਿਛੁ ਹੋਆ ਸੁ ਤੇਰਾ ਭਾਣਾ ॥
section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Whatever happens is by the Pleasure of Your Will.

transliteration.text: jō kish hōā s tērā bhānā .

melody.description: Bibhas Parbhati has a self-assured character and has a sense of certainty, which arises from the knowledge gained through awareness. It conveys the wisdom achieved from learning, which inspires contentment. However, this wisdom is not arrogant, but is gentle in its persuasion because there is not a need to ‘show-off’ this knowledge, but a desire to share it, so the recipient is able to learn.

text: ਜੋ ਇਵ ਬੂਝੈ ਸੁ ਸਹਜਿ ਸਮਾਣਾ ॥੩॥
section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Whoever understands this, is intuitively merged in the Lord. ||3||

transliteration.text: jō iv būjhai s sahaj samānā .3.

melody.description: Bibhas Parbhati has a self-assured character and has a sense of certainty, which arises from the knowledge gained through awareness. It conveys the wisdom achieved from learning, which inspires contentment. section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Kabeer, my sins have been obliterated.

It conveys the wisdom achieved from learning, which inspires contentment. section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: My mind has merged into the Lord, the Life of the World. ||4||1||
